intro: Physorhynchus chamaerapistrum, commonly known as the common marsh rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Berberidaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive arrangement of leaflets and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in early spring. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its propagation. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in wet conditions and its historical use in traditional medicine.
